intro: Galium ovitdaghense, commonly known as the Ovittagha bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late summer. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
